  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_5i" name="post[updated_at(5i)]">\n}
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 16}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, datetime_select("post", "updated_at", :order => [:minute, :day, :hour, :month, :year, :second])
end
test_datetime_select_should_not_change_passed_options_hash()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2626
def test_datetime_select_should_not_change_passed_options_hash
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = Time.local(2008, 7, 16, 23, 30)

  options = {
    :order => [ :year, :month, :day ],
    :default => { :year => 2008, :month => 7, :day => 16, :hour => 23, :minute => 30, :second => 1 },
    :discard_type => false,
    :include_blank => false,
    :ignore_date => false,
    :include_seconds => true
  }
  datetime_select(@post, :updated_at, options)

  # note: the literal hash is intentional to show that the actual options hash isn't modified
  #       don't change this!
  assert_equal({
    :order => [ :year, :month, :day ],
    :default => { :year => 2008, :month => 7, :day => 16, :hour => 23, :minute => 30, :second => 1 },
    :discard_type => false,
    :include_blank => false,
    :ignore_date => false,
    :include_seconds => true
  }, options)
end
test_datetime_select_with_auto_index()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2257
def test_datetime_select_with_auto_index
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 16, 35)
  id = @post.id

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_123_updated_at_1i" name="post[#{id}][updated_at(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_123_updated_at_2i" name="post[#{id}][updated_at(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_123_updated_at_3i" name="post[#{id}][updated_at(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " &mdash; "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_123_updated_at_4i" name="post[#{id}][updated_at(4i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16" selected="selected">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_123_updated_at_5i" name="post[#{id}][updated_at(5i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n<option value="32">32</option>\n<option value="33">33</option>\n<option value="34">34</option>\n<option value="35" selected="selected">35</option>\n<option value="36">36</option>\n<option value="37">37</option>\n<option value="38">38</option>\n<option value="39">39</option>\n<option value="40">40</option>\n<option value="41">41</option>\n<option value="42">42</option>\n<option value="43">43</option>\n<option value="44">44</option>\n<option value="45">45</option>\n<option value="46">46</option>\n<option value="47">47</option>\n<option value="48">48</option>\n<option value="49">49</option>\n<option value="50">50</option>\n<option value="51">51</option>\n<option value="52">52</option>\n<option value="53">53</option>\n<option value="54">54</option>\n<option value="55">55</option>\n<option value="56">56</option>\n<option value="57">57</option>\n<option value="58">58</option>\n<option value="59">59</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, datetime_select("post[]", "updated_at")
end
test_datetime_select_with_custom_prompt()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2071
def test_datetime_select_with_custom_prompt
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = nil

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_1i" name="post[updated_at(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Choose year</option>\n<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_2i" name="post[updated_at(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Choose month</option>\n<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_3i" name="post[updated_at(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Choose day</option>\n<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " &mdash; "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_4i" name="post[updated_at(4i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Choose hour</option>\n<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_5i" name="post[updated_at(5i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Choose minute</option>\n<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n<option value="32">32</option>\n<option value="33">33</option>\n<option value="34">34</option>\n<option value="35">35</option>\n<option value="36">36</option>\n<option value="37">37</option>\n<option value="38">38</option>\n<option value="39">39</option>\n<option value="40">40</option>\n<option value="41">41</option>\n<option value="42">42</option>\n<option value="43">43</option>\n<option value="44">44</option>\n<option value="45">45</option>\n<option value="46">46</option>\n<option value="47">47</option>\n<option value="48">48</option>\n<option value="49">49</option>\n<option value="50">50</option>\n<option value="51">51</option>\n<option value="52">52</option>\n<option value="53">53</option>\n<option value="54">54</option>\n<option value="55">55</option>\n<option value="56">56</option>\n<option value="57">57</option>\n<option value="58">58</option>\n<option value="59">59</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, datetime_select("post", "updated_at", :start_year=>1999, :end_year=>2009, :prompt => {:year => 'Choose year', :month => 'Choose month', :day => 'Choose day', :hour => 'Choose hour', :minute => 'Choose minute'})
end
test_datetime_select_with_default_prompt()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2042
def test_datetime_select_with_default_prompt
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = nil

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_1i" name="post[updated_at(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Year</option>\n<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_2i" name="post[updated_at(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Month</option>\n<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_3i" name="post[updated_at(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Day</option>\n<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " &mdash; "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_4i" name="post[updated_at(4i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Hour</option>\n<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_5i" name="post[updated_at(5i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Minute</option>\n<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n<option value="32">32</option>\n<option value="33">33</option>\n<option value="34">34</option>\n<option value="35">35</option>\n<option value="36">36</option>\n<option value="37">37</option>\n<option value="38">38</option>\n<option value="39">39</option>\n<option value="40">40</option>\n<option value="41">41</option>\n<option value="42">42</option>\n<option value="43">43</option>\n<option value="44">44</option>\n<option value="45">45</option>\n<option value="46">46</option>\n<option value="47">47</option>\n<option value="48">48</option>\n<option value="49">49</option>\n<option value="50">50</option>\n<option value="51">51</option>\n<option value="52">52</option>\n<option value="53">53</option>\n<option value="54">54</option>\n<option value="55">55</option>\n<option value="56">56</option>\n<option value="57">57</option>\n<option value="58">58</option>\n<option value="59">59</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, datetime_select("post", "updated_at", :start_year=>1999, :end_year=>2009,  :prompt => true)
end
test_datetime_select_with_default_value_as_hash()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2544
def test_datetime_select_with_default_value_as_hash
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = nil

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_1i" name="post[updated_at(1i)]">\n}
  (Time.now.year - 5).upto(Time.now.year + 5) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == Time.now.year}>#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_2i" name="post[updated_at(2i)]">\n}
  1.upto(12) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 10}>#{Date::MONTHNAMES[i]}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_3i" name="post[updated_at(3i)]">\n}
  1.upto(31) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == Time.now.day}>#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " &mdash; "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_4i" name="post[updated_at(4i)]">\n}
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 9}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_5i" name="post[updated_at(5i)]">\n}
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 42}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, datetime_select("post", "updated_at", :default => { :month => 10, :minute => 42, :hour => 9 })
end
test_datetime_select_with_default_value_as_time()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2497
def test_datetime_select_with_default_value_as_time
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = nil

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_1i" name="post[updated_at(1i)]">\n}
  2001.upto(2011) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 2006}>#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_2i" name="post[updated_at(2i)]">\n}
  1.upto(12) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 9}>#{Date::MONTHNAMES[i]}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_3i" name="post[updated_at(3i)]">\n}
  1.upto(31) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 19}>#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " &mdash; "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_4i" name="post[updated_at(4i)]">\n}
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_5i" name="post[updated_at(5i)]">\n}
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 16}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, datetime_select("post", "updated_at", :default => Time.local(2006, 9, 19, 15, 16, 35))
end
test_datetime_select_with_html_options()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2571
def test_datetime_select_with_html_options
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 16, 35)

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_1i" name="post[updated_at(1i)]" class="selector">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_2i" name="post[updated_at(2i)]" class="selector">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_3i" name="post[updated_at(3i)]" class="selector">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " &mdash; "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_4i" name="post[updated_at(4i)]" class="selector">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16" selected="selected">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_5i" name="post[updated_at(5i)]" class="selector">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n<option value="32">32</option>\n<option value="33">33</option>\n<option value="34">34</option>\n<option value="35" selected="selected">35</option>\n<option value="36">36</option>\n<option value="37">37</option>\n<option value="38">38</option>\n<option value="39">39</option>\n<option value="40">40</option>\n<option value="41">41</option>\n<option value="42">42</option>\n<option value="43">43</option>\n<option value="44">44</option>\n<option value="45">45</option>\n<option value="46">46</option>\n<option value="47">47</option>\n<option value="48">48</option>\n<option value="49">49</option>\n<option value="50">50</option>\n<option value="51">51</option>\n<option value="52">52</option>\n<option value="53">53</option>\n<option value="54">54</option>\n<option value="55">55</option>\n<option value="56">56</option>\n<option value="57">57</option>\n<option value="58">58</option>\n<option value="59">59</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, datetime_select("post", "updated_at", {}, :class => 'selector')
end
test_datetime_select_with_html_options_within_fields_for()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1984
def test_datetime_select_with_html_options_within_fields_for
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 16, 35)

  output_buffer = fields_for :post, @post do |f|
    concat f.datetime_select(:updated_at, {}, :class => 'selector')
  end

  expected = "<select id='post_updated_at_1i' name='post[updated_at(1i)]' class='selector'>\n<option value='1999'>1999</option>\n<option value='2000'>2000</option>\n<option value='2001'>2001</option>\n<option value='2002'>2002</option>\n<option value='2003'>2003</option>\n<option selected='selected' value='2004'>2004</option>\n<option value='2005'>2005</option>\n<option value='2006'>2006</option>\n<option value='2007'>2007</option>\n<option value='2008'>2008</option>\n<option value='2009'>2009</option>\n</select>\n"
  expected << "<select id='post_updated_at_2i' name='post[updated_at(2i)]' class='selector'>\n<option value='1'>January</option>\n<option value='2'>February</option>\n<option value='3'>March</option>\n<option value='4'>April</option>\n<option value='5'>May</option>\n<option selected='selected' value='6'>June</option>\n<option value='7'>July</option>\n<option value='8'>August</option>\n<option value='9'>September</option>\n<option value='10'>October</option>\n<option value='11'>November</option>\n<option value='12'>December</option>\n</select>\n"
  expected << "<select id='post_updated_at_3i' name='post[updated_at(3i)]' class='selector'>\n<option value='1'>1</option>\n<option value='2'>2</option>\n<option value='3'>3</option>\n<option value='4'>4</option>\n<option value='5'>5</option>\n<option value='6'>6</option>\n<option value='7'>7</option>\n<option value='8'>8</option>\n<option value='9'>9</option>\n<option value='10'>10</option>\n<option value='11'>11</option>\n<option value='12'>12</option>\n<option value='13'>13</option>\n<option value='14'>14</option>\n<option selected='selected' value='15'>15</option>\n<option value='16'>16</option>\n<option value='17'>17</option>\n<option value='18'>18</option>\n<option value='19'>19</option>\n<option value='20'>20</option>\n<option value='21'>21</option>\n<option value='22'>22</option>\n<option value='23'>23</option>\n<option value='24'>24</option>\n<option value='25'>25</option>\n<option value='26'>26</option>\n<option value='27'>27</option>\n<option value='28'>28</option>\n<option value='29'>29</option>\n<option value='30'>30</option>\n<option value='31'>31</option>\n</select>\n"
  expected << " &mdash; <select id='post_updated_at_4i' name='post[updated_at(4i)]' class='selector'>\n<option value='00'>00</option>\n<option value='01'>01</option>\n<option value='02'>02</option>\n<option value='03'>03</option>\n<option value='04'>04</option>\n<option value='05'>05</option>\n<option value='06'>06</option>\n<option value='07'>07</option>\n<option value='08'>08</option>\n<option value='09'>09</option>\n<option value='10'>10</option>\n<option value='11'>11</option>\n<option value='12'>12</option>\n<option value='13'>13</option>\n<option value='14'>14</option>\n<option value='15'>15</option>\n<option selected='selected' value='16'>16</option>\n<option value='17'>17</option>\n<option value='18'>18</option>\n<option value='19'>19</option>\n<option value='20'>20</option>\n<option value='21'>21</option>\n<option value='22'>22</option>\n<option value='23'>23</option>\n</select>\n"
  expected << " : <select id='post_updated_at_5i' name='post[updated_at(5i)]' class='selector'>\n<option value='00'>00</option>\n<option value='01'>01</option>\n<option value='02'>02</option>\n<option value='03'>03</option>\n<option value='04'>04</option>\n<option value='05'>05</option>\n<option value='06'>06</option>\n<option value='07'>07</option>\n<option value='08'>08</option>\n<option value='09'>09</option>\n<option value='10'>10</option>\n<option value='11'>11</option>\n<option value='12'>12</option>\n<option value='13'>13</option>\n<option value='14'>14</option>\n<option value='15'>15</option>\n<option value='16'>16</option>\n<option value='17'>17</option>\n<option value='18'>18</option>\n<option value='19'>19</option>\n<option value='20'>20</option>\n<option value='21'>21</option>\n<option value='22'>22</option>\n<option value='23'>23</option>\n<option value='24'>24</option>\n<option value='25'>25</option>\n<option value='26'>26</option>\n<option value='27'>27</option>\n<option value='28'>28</option>\n<option value='29'>29</option>\n<option value='30'>30</option>\n<option value='31'>31</option>\n<option value='32'>32</option>\n<option value='33'>33</option>\n<option value='34'>34</option>\n<option selected='selected' value='35'>35</option>\n<option value='36'>36</option>\n<option value='37'>37</option>\n<option value='38'>38</option>\n<option value='39'>39</option>\n<option value='40'>40</option>\n<option value='41'>41</option>\n<option value='42'>42</option>\n<option value='43'>43</option>\n<option value='44'>44</option>\n<option value='45'>45</option>\n<option value='46'>46</option>\n<option value='47'>47</option>\n<option value='48'>48</option>\n<option value='49'>49</option>\n<option value='50'>50</option>\n<option value='51'>51</option>\n<option value='52'>52</option>\n<option value='53'>53</option>\n<option value='54'>54</option>\n<option value='55'>55</option>\n<option value='56'>56</option>\n<option value='57'>57</option>\n<option value='58'>58</option>\n<option value='59'>59</option>\n</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, output_buffer
end
test_datetime_select_with_nil_value_and_no_start_and_end_year()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2165
def test_datetime_select_with_nil_value_and_no_start_and_end_year
  expected =  %Q(<select id="date_first_year" name="date[first][year]">\n)
  (Date.today.year-5).upto(Date.today.year+5) { |y| expected << %Q(<option value="#{y}">#{y}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_month" name="date[first][month]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_day" name="date[first][day]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " &mdash; "

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_hour" name="date[first][hour]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " : "

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_minute" name="date[first][minute]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n<option value="32">32</option>\n<option value="33">33</option>\n<option value="34">34</option>\n<option value="35">35</option>\n<option value="36">36</option>\n<option value="37">37</option>\n<option value="38">38</option>\n<option value="39">39</option>\n<option value="40">40</option>\n<option value="41">41</option>\n<option value="42">42</option>\n<option value="43">43</option>\n<option value="44">44</option>\n<option value="45">45</option>\n<option value="46">46</option>\n<option value="47">47</option>\n<option value="48">48</option>\n<option value="49">49</option>\n<option value="50">50</option>\n<option value="51">51</option>\n<option value="52">52</option>\n<option value="53">53</option>\n<option value="54">54</option>\n<option value="55">55</option>\n<option value="56">56</option>\n<option value="57">57</option>\n<option value="58">58</option>\n<option value="59">59</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_datetime(nil, :prefix => "date[first]")
end
test_datetime_select_with_options_index()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2193
def test_datetime_select_with_options_index
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 16, 35)
  id = 456

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_456_updated_at_1i" name="post[#{id}][updated_at(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_456_updated_at_2i" name="post[#{id}][updated_at(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_456_updated_at_3i" name="post[#{id}][updated_at(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " &mdash; "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_456_updated_at_4i" name="post[#{id}][updated_at(4i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16" selected="selected">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_456_updated_at_5i" name="post[#{id}][updated_at(5i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n<option value="32">32</option>\n<option value="33">33</option>\n<option value="34">34</option>\n<option value="35" selected="selected">35</option>\n<option value="36">36</option>\n<option value="37">37</option>\n<option value="38">38</option>\n<option value="39">39</option>\n<option value="40">40</option>\n<option value="41">41</option>\n<option value="42">42</option>\n<option value="43">43</option>\n<option value="44">44</option>\n<option value="45">45</option>\n<option value="46">46</option>\n<option value="47">47</option>\n<option value="48">48</option>\n<option value="49">49</option>\n<option value="50">50</option>\n<option value="51">51</option>\n<option value="52">52</option>\n<option value="53">53</option>\n<option value="54">54</option>\n<option value="55">55</option>\n<option value="56">56</option>\n<option value="57">57</option>\n<option value="58">58</option>\n<option value="59">59</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, datetime_select("post", "updated_at", :index => id)
end
test_datetime_select_with_seconds()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2287
def test_datetime_select_with_seconds
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 15, 16, 35)

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_1i" name="post[updated_at(1i)]">\n}
  1999.upto(2009) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 2004}>#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_2i" name="post[updated_at(2i)]">\n}
  1.upto(12) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 6}>#{Date::MONTHNAMES[i]}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_3i" name="post[updated_at(3i)]">\n}
  1.upto(31) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " &mdash; "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_4i" name="post[updated_at(4i)]">\n}
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_5i" name="post[updated_at(5i)]">\n}
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 16}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_6i" name="post[updated_at(6i)]">\n}
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 35}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, datetime_select("post", "updated_at", :include_seconds => true)
end
test_datetime_select_with_separators()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2001
def test_datetime_select_with_separators
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 15, 16, 35)

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_1i" name="post[updated_at(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " / "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_2i" name="post[updated_at(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " / "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_3i" name="post[updated_at(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " , "

  expected << %Q(<select id="post_updated_at_4i" name="post[updated_at(4i)]">\n)
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " - "

  expected << %Q(<select id="post_updated_at_5i" name="post[updated_at(5i)]">\n)
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 16}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " - "

  expected << %Q(<select id="post_updated_at_6i" name="post[updated_at(6i)]">\n)
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 35}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, datetime_select("post", "updated_at", { :date_separator => " / ", :datetime_separator => " , ", :time_separator => " - ", :include_seconds => true })
end
test_datetime_select_within_fields_for_with_options_index()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2223
def test_datetime_select_within_fields_for_with_options_index
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 16, 35)
  id = 456

  output_buffer = fields_for :post, @post, :index => id do |f|
    concat f.datetime_select(:updated_at)
  end

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_456_updated_at_1i" name="post[#{id}][updated_at(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_456_updated_at_2i" name="post[#{id}][updated_at(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_456_updated_at_3i" name="post[#{id}][updated_at(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " &mdash; "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_456_updated_at_4i" name="post[#{id}][updated_at(4i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16" selected="selected">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_456_updated_at_5i" name="post[#{id}][updated_at(5i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n<option value="32">32</option>\n<option value="33">33</option>\n<option value="34">34</option>\n<option value="35" selected="selected">35</option>\n<option value="36">36</option>\n<option value="37">37</option>\n<option value="38">38</option>\n<option value="39">39</option>\n<option value="40">40</option>\n<option value="41">41</option>\n<option value="42">42</option>\n<option value="43">43</option>\n<option value="44">44</option>\n<option value="45">45</option>\n<option value="46">46</option>\n<option value="47">47</option>\n<option value="48">48</option>\n<option value="49">49</option>\n<option value="50">50</option>\n<option value="51">51</option>\n<option value="52">52</option>\n<option value="53">53</option>\n<option value="54">54</option>\n<option value="55">55</option>\n<option value="56">56</option>\n<option value="57">57</option>\n<option value="58">58</option>\n<option value="59">59</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, output_buffer
end
test_distance_in_words()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 101
def test_distance_in_words
  from = Time.utc(2004, 6, 6, 21, 45, 0)
  assert_distance_of_time_in_words(from)
end
test_distance_in_words_with_dates()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 120
def test_distance_in_words_with_dates
  start_date = Date.new 1975, 1, 31
  end_date = Date.new 1977, 1, 31
  assert_equal("about 2 years", distance_of_time_in_words(start_date, end_date))

  start_date = Date.new 1982, 12, 3
  end_date = Date.new 2010, 11, 30
  assert_equal("almost 28 years", distance_of_time_in_words(start_date, end_date))
end
test_distance_in_words_with_different_time_zones()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 112
def test_distance_in_words_with_different_time_zones
  from = Time.mktime(2004, 6, 6, 21, 45, 0)
  assert_distance_of_time_in_words(
    from.in_time_zone('Alaska'),
    from.in_time_zone('Hawaii')
  )
end
test_distance_in_words_with_integers()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 130
def test_distance_in_words_with_integers
  assert_equal "less than a minute", distance_of_time_in_words(59)
  assert_equal "about 1 hour", distance_of_time_in_words(60*60)
  assert_equal "less than a minute", distance_of_time_in_words(0, 59)
  assert_equal "about 1 hour", distance_of_time_in_words(60*60, 0)
end
test_distance_in_words_with_time_zones()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 106
def test_distance_in_words_with_time_zones
  from = Time.mktime(2004, 6, 6, 21, 45, 0)
  assert_distance_of_time_in_words(from.in_time_zone('Alaska'))
  assert_distance_of_time_in_words(from.in_time_zone('Hawaii'))
end
test_include_blank_overrides_default_option()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2524
def test_include_blank_overrides_default_option
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = nil

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_1i" name="post[updated_at(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q(<option value=""></option>\n)
  (Time.now.year - 5).upto(Time.now.year + 5) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}">#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_2i" name="post[updated_at(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q(<option value=""></option>\n)
  1.upto(12) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}">#{Date::MONTHNAMES[i]}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_3i" name="post[updated_at(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q(<option value=""></option>\n)
  1.upto(31) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}">#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "updated_at", :default => Time.local(2006, 9, 19, 15, 16, 35), :include_blank => true)
end
test_object_select_html_safety()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2761
def test_object_select_html_safety
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  assert date_select("post", "written_on", :default => Time.local(2006, 9, 19, 15, 16, 35), :include_blank => true).html_safe?
  assert time_select("post", "written_on", :ignore_date => true).html_safe?
end
test_select_date()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 651
def test_select_date
  expected =  %Q(<select id="date_first_year" name="date[first][year]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="2003" selected="selected">2003</option>\n<option value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_month" name="date[first][month]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8" selected="selected">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_day" name="date[first][day]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16" selected="selected">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_date(Time.mktime(2003, 8, 16), :start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005, :prefix => "date[first]")
end
test_select_date_should_not_change_passed_options_hash()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2678
def test_select_date_should_not_change_passed_options_hash
  options = {
    :order => [ :year, :month, :day ],
    :default => { :year => 2008, :month => 7, :day => 16, :hour => 23, :minute => 30, :second => 1 },
    :discard_type => false,
    :include_blank => false,
    :ignore_date => false,
    :include_seconds => true
  }
  select_date(Date.today, options)

  # note: the literal hash is intentional to show that the actual options hash isn't modified
  #       don't change this!
  assert_equal({
    :order => [ :year, :month, :day ],
    :default => { :year => 2008, :month => 7, :day => 16, :hour => 23, :minute => 30, :second => 1 },
    :discard_type => false,
    :include_blank => false,
    :ignore_date => false,
    :include_seconds => true
  }, options)
end
test_select_date_with_disabled()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 692
def test_select_date_with_disabled
  expected =  %Q(<select id="date_first_year" name="date[first][year]" disabled="disabled">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="2003" selected="selected">2003</option>\n<option value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_month" name="date[first][month]" disabled="disabled">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8" selected="selected">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_day" name="date[first][day]" disabled="disabled">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16" selected="selected">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_date(Time.mktime(2003, 8, 16), :start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005, :prefix => "date[first]", :disabled => true)
end
test_select_date_with_html_options()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 861
def test_select_date_with_html_options
  expected =  %Q(<select id="date_first_year" name="date[first][year]" class="selector">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="2003" selected="selected">2003</option>\n<option value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_month" name="date[first][month]" class="selector">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8" selected="selected">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_day" name="date[first][day]" class="selector">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16" selected="selected">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_date(Time.mktime(2003, 8, 16), {:start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005, :prefix => "date[first]"}, :class => "selector")
end
test_select_date_with_incomplete_order()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 683
def test_select_date_with_incomplete_order
  # Since the order is incomplete nothing will be shown
  expected = %Q(<input id="date_first_year" name="date[first][year]" type="hidden" value="2003" />\n)
  expected << %Q(<input id="date_first_month" name="date[first][month]" type="hidden" value="8" />\n)
  expected << %Q(<input id="date_first_day" name="date[first][day]" type="hidden" value="16" />\n)

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_date(Time.mktime(2003, 8, 16), :start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005, :prefix => "date[first]", :order => [:day])
end
test_select_date_with_nil_value_and_no_start_and_end_year()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 845
def test_select_date_with_nil_value_and_no_start_and_end_year
  expected =  %Q(<select id="date_first_year" name="date[first][year]">\n)
  (Date.today.year-5).upto(Date.today.year+5) { |y| expected << %Q(<option value="#{y}">#{y}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_month" name="date[first][month]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_day" name="date[first][day]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_date(nil, :prefix => "date[first]")
end
test_select_date_with_no_end_year()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 732
def test_select_date_with_no_end_year
  expected =  %Q(<select id="date_first_year" name="date[first][year]">\n)
  2003.upto(2008) do |y|
    if y == 2003
      expected << %Q(<option value="#{y}" selected="selected">#{y}</option>\n)
    else
      expected << %Q(<option value="#{y}">#{y}</option>\n)
    end
  end
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_month" name="date[first][month]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8" selected="selected">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_day" name="date[first][day]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16" selected="selected">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_date(
    Time.mktime(2003, 8, 16), :start_year => 2003, :prefix => "date[first]"
  )
end
test_select_date_with_no_start_or_end_year()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 756
def test_select_date_with_no_start_or_end_year
  expected =  %Q(<select id="date_first_year" name="date[first][year]">\n)
  (Date.today.year-5).upto(Date.today.year+5) do |y|
    if y == Date.today.year
      expected << %Q(<option value="#{y}" selected="selected">#{y}</option>\n)
    else
      expected << %Q(<option value="#{y}">#{y}</option>\n)
    end
  end
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_month" name="date[first][month]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8" selected="selected">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_day" name="date[first][day]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16" selected="selected">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_date(
    Time.mktime(Date.today.year, 8, 16), :prefix => "date[first]"
  )
end
test_select_date_with_no_start_year()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 708
def test_select_date_with_no_start_year
  expected =  %Q(<select id="date_first_year" name="date[first][year]">\n)
  (Date.today.year-5).upto(Date.today.year+1) do |y|
    if y == Date.today.year
      expected << %Q(<option value="#{y}" selected="selected">#{y}</option>\n)
    else
      expected << %Q(<option value="#{y}">#{y}</option>\n)
    end
  end
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_month" name="date[first][month]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8" selected="selected">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_day" name="date[first][day]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16" selected="selected">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_date(
    Time.mktime(Date.today.year, 8, 16), :end_year => Date.today.year+1, :prefix => "date[first]"
  )
end
test_select_date_with_order()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 667
def test_select_date_with_order
  expected = %Q(<select id="date_first_month" name="date[first][month]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8" selected="selected">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_day" name="date[first][day]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16" selected="selected">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected <<  %Q(<select id="date_first_year" name="date[first][year]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="2003" selected="selected">2003</option>\n<option value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_date(Time.mktime(2003, 8, 16), :start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005, :prefix => "date[first]", :order => [:month, :day, :year])
end
test_select_date_with_separator()

Source: show 

# File actionpack/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 877
def test_select_date_with_separator
  expected =  %Q(<select id="date_first_year" name="date[first][year]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="2003" selected="selected">2003</option>\n<option value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " / "

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_month" name="date[first][month]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8" selected="selected">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " / "

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_day" name="date[first][day]">\n)
